This means the `uploads` folder is not in the webdir anymore which is better for several reasons. I can update different components to a major version (bootstrap, twig), use Webpack to deal better with the Javascripts, remove all the minified files from the git tracking. This means more work to install it without Docker, but the Docker method being the recommended one it's ok. It also means the repository is smaller and faster to clone. So basically with 2.0 I felt free to break everything and then rebuild it better after, without having to worry about anything (as long as I can write a proper upgrade documentation for non docker users!).

CHANGELOG:

New features:

* Add Slovak lang − thanks to Martin Petriska from Bratislava
* Add 100% translated Russian lang − thanks to Mark T
* Database items now have comments (#508)
* Add option in user control panel to allow experiment edition from members of the team (#498)
* Allow creation of Links through API (#599)
* Add a Tag Manager in the admin panel so the admin can correct typos or remove tags (#715)
* Add Mathjax support for pretty mathematical expressions (#208)
* Add visibility to database items (#541)
* Add support for Nanobox.io deployment
* Add possibility to add a caption to inserted images (#241)
* Add Open Science mode allowing unregistered users to read experiments in a team (#718)
* Add EXPERIMENTAL feature for streaming zip archives (allows big zip) Enable it from UCP.
* Add option for french style signatures block in pdf (#726)
* Add possibility to download file through API (#798 #797)

Enhancements:

* Allow to search for tags with string from the middle of the tag (#702)
* Better user interface for Steps, Links and Todolist (#559)
* Show steps in view mode
* Use SVG icons instead of PNG
* Show owner in show mode if not current user for experiments (#616)
* Add relative moment for displaying a date
* Display locked date in view mode when hovering the lock icon (#189)
* Add Steps to PDFs (#189)
* Add more actions to the top right menu
* Page load is cleaner
* Add a version query string to assets to prevent caching of old versions
* Add more infos on Sysconfig page and reorganize the tabs
* Show 25 items instead of 10 for mention plugin (#641)
* Remove the 60 characters limit on autocomplete
* Updated translations
* Zip generation is less likely to fail

Bugfixes:

* Display edit icon in show mode for admins (#498)
* Fix permission issue when deleting experiment from show mode
* Fix order by category not working for experiments (#698)
* Fix revisions for admin (#662)
* Fix issues in SAML login if team is empty
* Fix tags not being imported when template is duplicated
* Fix steps/link not working with a '%' character (#791)
* Fix possibility to update category/visibility of locked item (#792)
* Fix issue with order by and sort (#790)
* Fix issue with comments (#802)

Dev corner:

* Mininum PHP version is now 7.1
* Update SwiftMailer to version 6
* Update Twig to version 2
* Update Bootstrap to version 4
* Use Webpack 4 to create bundles (using tree shaking feature to make smaller bundles)
* Use ES6 syntax for Javascript (const/let instead of var for instance)
* Drop phpdocumentor dependency in composer.json, use the phar instead
* Use type hinting
* Use strict_types
* Replace strlen() by mb_strlen()
* Use dirname(__DIR__) instead of relative paths
* Move the `cache` folder outside of `uploads`
* Split code in `web` and `src` folders
* Function signatures are more coherent
* Use random_bytes() to get random numbers
* Use chromedriver for acceptance tests
* Deduplicate the mysql structure file
* Remove custom css class. Use bootstrap classes instead
* Use monolog for logging to the webserver error file
* Use utf8mb4 in fresh MySQL database creation
* Replace uniqid() with random_bytes()


ENJOY :tada:  and please report bugs :D

result.name: elabftw-2.0.0-alpha2
result.description:
Hello,

This is an alpha release of the upcoming 2.0.0 version of elabftw. This release is a snapshot of the current development branch. It very likely contains a few bugs. Do not use if numerous users depend on it, but do test it if you can! Your help in tracking bugs is invaluable. I do my best to test as much as possible but there is always edge cases. If you have the knowledge, make a copy of your current install and do the upgrade in another instance of elabftw.



**To test this release:**

* For Docker users: edit your elabftw.yml file (located in /etc by default) and change the line `image: elabftw/elabimg` to `image: elabftw/elabimg:next`. And do `elabctl update`. This will upgrade your current installation.

* For non Docker users: `git checkout -b next && git pull origin next` and [read the upgrade guide](https://elabftw.readthedocs.io/en/next/how-to-update.html#complete-upgrade-guide-from-1-8-x-to-2-0-0).

Note that you need to access the documentation hosted on [readthedocs](https://elabftw.readthedocs.io/en/next) because the one on doc.elabftw.net is for the stable version.

## CHANGELOG

### Why this update?
Sometimes, you have to break things to make them better. With the version 2 I can remove support for php 5.6, allowing me to use the latest versions of some dependencies, and also type hinting, a new feature of the PHP language. I can move the web served directory to a separate directory that is not the root directory of the repo. This means the `uploads` folder is not in the webdir anymore which is better for several reasons. I can update different components to a major version (bootstrap, twig), use Webpack to deal better with the Javascripts, remove all the minified files from the git tracking. This means more work to install it without Docker, but the Docker method being the recommended one it's ok. It also means the repository is smaller and faster to clone. So basically with 2.0 I felt free to break everything and then rebuild it better after, without having to worry about anything (as long as I can write a proper upgrade documentation for non docker users!).

CHANGELOG:

New features:

* Add Slovak lang − thanks to Martin Petriska from Bratislava
* Add 100% translated Russian lang − thanks to Mark T
* Database items now have comments (#508)
* Add option in user control panel to allow experiment edition from members of the team (#498)
* Allow creation of Links through API (#599)
* Add a Tag Manager in the admin panel so the admin can correct typos or remove tags (#715)
* Add Mathjax support for pretty mathematical expressions (#208)
* Add visibility to database items (#541)
* Add support for Nanobox.io deployment
* Add possibility to add a caption to inserted images (#241)
* Add Open Science mode allowing unregistered users to read experiments in a team (#718)
* Add EXPERIMENTAL feature for streaming zip archives (allows big zip) Enable it from UCP.
* Add option for french style signatures block in pdf (#726)
* Add possibility to download file through API (#798 #797)

Enhancements:

* Allow to search for tags with string from the middle of the tag (#702)
* Better user interface for Steps, Links and Todolist (#559)
* Show steps in view mode
* Use SVG icons instead of PNG
* Show owner in show mode if not current user for experiments (#616)
* Add relative moment for displaying a date
* Display locked date in view mode when hovering the lock icon (#189)
* Add Steps to PDFs (#189)
* Add more actions to the top right menu
* Page load is cleaner
* Add a version query string to assets to prevent caching of old versions
* Add more infos on Sysconfig page and reorganize the tabs
* Show 25 items instead of 10 for mention plugin (#641)
* Remove the 60 characters limit on autocomplete
* Updated translations
* Zip generation is less likely to fail

Bugfixes:

* Display edit icon in show mode for admins (#498)
* Fix permission issue when deleting experiment from show mode
* Fix order by category not working for experiments (#698)
* Fix revisions for admin (#662)
* Fix issues in SAML login if team is empty
* Fix tags not being imported when template is duplicated
* Fix steps/link not working with a '%' character (#791)
* Fix possibility to update category/visibility of locked item (#792)
* Fix issue with order by and sort (#790)
* Fix issue with comments (#802)

Dev corner:

* Mininum PHP version is now 7.1
* Update SwiftMailer to version 6
* Update Twig to version 2
* Update Bootstrap to version 4
* Use Webpack 4 to create bundles (using tree shaking feature to make smaller bundles)
* Use ES6 syntax for Javascript (const/let instead of var for instance)
* Drop phpdocumentor dependency in composer.json, use the phar instead
* Use type hinting
* Use strict_types
* Replace strlen() by mb_strlen()
* Use dirname(__DIR__) instead of relative paths
* Move the `cache` folder outside of `uploads`
* Split code in `web` and `src` folders
* Function signatures are more coherent
* Use random_bytes() to get random numbers
* Use chromedriver for acceptance tests
* Deduplicate the mysql structure file
* Remove custom css class. Use bootstrap classes instead
* Use monolog for logging to the webserver error file
* Use utf8mb4 in fresh MySQL database creation
* Replace uniqid() with random_bytes()


ENJOY :tada:  and please report bugs :D

result.name: elabftw-1.8.3
result.description:
New release: 1.8.3 :fleur_de_lis: 

The only bugfix here is a problem that happened if a user stays for too long on the edit page of an experiment/database item and the session times out but the user is not aware of it. Now the data will get saved in LocalStorage and the user will be redirected to the login page.

There is also a new option in the sysadmin page to specify the canonical URL of the install. This will prevent issues on some specific setups where the guessing was not good.

Changelog:

* Bugfixes:

  * Fix issue when user stays on edit page long enough for the server session to end and data could not be saved

* Enhancements:

  * The tag is saved with onBlur event (because it was not obvious that you had to press enter to save it)
  * The cookies checkbox is now checked by default
  * Add option to specify the full URL of the install to prevent issues with URL guessing on some setups (#567)

* Updates:

  * Update TinyMCE from 4.7.5 to 4.7.9
  * Update jquery-jeditable to 2.0.0

### [How to update](https://doc.elabftw.net/how-to-update.html)
### [How to install](https://doc.elabftw.net/)

result.name: elabftw-1.8.0
result.description:
I'm pleased to announce the release of elabftw 1.8.0 🌸 

[How to update](https://doc.elabftw.net/how-to-update.html)
[How to install](https://doc.elabftw.net/)

## Major new features:

### Login as anonymous
The sysadmin can activate this feature from the sysadmin panel and allow anonymous users to login by selecting a team on the login page. If there are experiments with visibility set to 'Public', anonymous users will be able to see them. If the admin of the team allowed it, they will also be able to see the database items. But they won't be able to create anything or edit anything.

### Archive a user
An archived user will not be able to connect anymore. All the experiments will become locked. Once archived, a user can register another account in another team if needed, with the same email.

### Import templates from the team
On the TEAM page, you can now see the templates from others in the team, and import them to your profile.

### Uploads replace
If you need to upload a newer version of a file, you can use the adequate button "Upload a new version of this file" to replace the file quickly.

### Docker changes
Some changes in the container were made to improve:
* the starting speed (by making the DH generation in the background)
* the container security (by restricting PHP greatly and storing sessions more securely)
* the application security (by adding a restrictive Content Security Policy header)

There is also a few new settings that can be added to the main configuration file as environment variables:
* [PHP_TIMEZONE](https://github.com/elabftw/elabimg/blob/master/src/docker-compose.yml-EXAMPLE#L46) to set the timezone
* [MAX_UPLOAD_SIZE](https://github.com/elabftw/elabimg/blob/master/src/docker-compose.yml-EXAMPLE#L44) to change the maximum allowed file size for uploaded files
* [MAX_PHP_MEMORY](https://github.com/elabftw/elabimg/blob/master/src/docker-compose.yml-EXAMPLE#L42) to change the maximum allowed memory for the PHP process
* [SET_REAL_IP](https://github.com/elabftw/elabimg/blob/master/src/docker-compose.yml-EXAMPLE#L48) and [SET_REAL_IP_FROM](https://github.com/elabftw/elabimg/blob/master/src/docker-compose.yml-EXAMPLE#L51) if you need to tell nginx to set the real ips from these addresses (if you're behind a load balancer for instance)

## Here is a full list of the changes:

* New features:

  * Add possibility to bulk change visibility for experiments (#527)
  * Add user option to prevent pdf from displaying attached files (#502)
  * Add possibility to add a tag from the API (#468)
  * Add option to disable PDF/A generation and make pdf lighter (no embedded fonts)
  * Add option to change paper format of PDF (A4, Letter, Royal)
  * Add possibility to allow anonymous logins (#279)
  * Add Public visibility to experiments. Will be visible to anonymous users
  * Add possibility to archive a user. The user can then create another account in another team (#483)
  * Add possibility to see and import templates from other members of the team
  * Add button to replace existing uploaded file with new version (#501)

* Enhancements:

  * Add link to revisions from view mode (#536)
  * Add pagination

* Updates:

  * Update Tinymce to 4.7.4
  * Update Fancybox to 3.2.5
  * Update Fullcalendar to 3.7.0
  * Update 3Dmol.js to 1.3.0
  * Update mPDF to version 7.0.2

* Docker:

  * Remove unsafe-inline and unsafe-eval from the Content Security Policy header: now elabftw can be used with a very restrictive CSP header
  * Make the Diffie-Hellman parameters generation in background for faster webserver startup
  * Disable unsafe functions in php.ini
  * Enable open_basedir restriction
  * Use longer SID, store sessions in separate directory with restrictive permissions
  * Disable allow_url_fopen
  * Add config for PHP timezone
  * Add config for setting "set_real_ip_from" in nginx config

* Bugfixes:

  * Fix bug where very long titles without spaces would break the layout (#517)
  * Fix bug where deleting a tag would result in another tag of the same item being deleted (#504)
  * Restrict scheduler slots edit to owner (#506)
  * Fix a display issue with very long titles with no spaces (#517)
  * Fix incorrect redirection in subfolder install (#549)

result.name: elabftw-1.7.6
result.description:
Hello,

I'm pleased to announce the immediate availability of **eLabFTW 1.7.6** :alien:

This new release is packed with **new features** requested by the community and numerous improvements in the user interface and user experience. Some bugs have also been fixed.

**NOTE**: users may be required to reload an elabftw page without cache to download the latest assets (ctrl-shift-r in firefox/chrome). Otherwise some functionality might not work until the browser decides to get the fresh version of the files.

### Changelog

#### Patch 1.7.6:

* Bugfixes:

  * Fix issue with the change-pass page (fix #481)
  * Fix minor issue with incorrect auth leading to SQL error display once

* Updates:

  * Update Tinymce
  * Update Fancybox
  * Update Fullcalendar

#### Patch 1.7.5:

* Bugfixes:

  * Fix bad redirect to install folder for old school install in subfolder of domain
  * Fix issues with the change status/delete menu in show mode
  * Fix issue with body overflowing when you toggle it from show mode (fix #469)
  * Fix bad display of checkbox in show mode
  * Fix issue with get_all_ functions in API

* Enhancement:

  * Add name of the experimenter on search page (fix #470)
  * Updated composer components
  * Updated tinymce and fullcalendar

#### Patch 1.7.4:

* Bugfixes:

  * Fix issue with checkboxes in show mode in Chrome/Safari (fix #465)
  * Fix issue with delete from checkboxes in show mode (fix #465)

#### Patch 1.7.3:

* Bugfix:

  * Fix issue updating if the database name was different from 'elabftw' (see #462)

#### Patch 1.7.2:

* Bugfix:

  * Fix issue with php 5.6 (fix #462)

#### Patch 1.7.1:

* Bugfix:

  * Fix issue with not correctly detecting HTTPS behind a proxy

#### Release 1.7.0:

* Bugfixes:

  * Fix permissions issue on team groups (fix #428)
  * Several minor bugfixes throughout the code

* New features:

  * Add Steps to experiments (fix #309)
  * Add tags to templates (fix #456)
  * Add a checkbox on items in show mode and a menu to apply an action to several items (fix #427)
  * Add a default Order by and Sort option in profile (fix #370)
  * Add a user preference for generating PDF with CJK fonts (fix #350)
  * Add user pref for single column layout (fix #410)
  * Add possibility to use Markdown in the text editor (fix #302)

* Enhancements:

  * Add the timestamped pdf to the zip archive (see #446)
  * Add an edit button in show mode
  * Check if deleted image is in body. Show warning (fix #432)
  * Submit the select-order-sort on change (fix #451)
  * Better performances in page loading speed
  * Add possibility to change the item type from edit mode
  * Gmagick is now optional. The code will fallback to gd if you don't have gmagick installed
  * Update ChemDoodle to 8.0.0
  * Remove forced capitalization of names (fix #461)

* Internationalization:

  * 100% translated in French
  * New strings need to be translated! See the contributing page to help

* Dev corner:

  * Use Symfony HttpFoundation components (Request/Response/Session/Cookies)
  * Use Guzzle for the requests instead of php-curl
  * Proper documentation of class fields
  * Better use of Twig templates
  * ...and a lot of code moved around, cleaned up, optimized, refactored, obliterated, fixed, ...

### [How to update](https://doc.elabftw.net/how-to-update.html)
### [How to install](https://doc.elabftw.net/)

result.name: elabftw-1.7.4
result.description:
Hello,

I'm pleased to announce the immediate relase of **eLabFTW 1.7.4** :alien:

This new release is packed with **new features** requested by the community and numerous improvements in the user interface and user experience. Some bugs have also been fixed.

### Changelog

#### Patch 1.7.4:

* Bugfixes:

  * Fix issue with checkboxes in show mode in Chrome/Safari (fix #465)
  * Fix issue with delete from checkboxes in show mode (fix #465)

#### Patch 1.7.3:

* Bugfix:

  * Fix issue updating if the database name was different from 'elabftw' (see #462)

#### Patch 1.7.2:

* Bugfix:

  * Fix issue with php 5.6 (fix #462)

#### Patch 1.7.1:

* Bugfix:

  * Fix issue with not correctly detecting HTTPS behind a proxy

#### Release 1.7.0:

* Bugfixes:

  * Fix permissions issue on team groups (fix #428)
  * Several minor bugfixes throughout the code

* New features:

  * Add Steps to experiments (fix #309)
  * Add tags to templates (fix #456)
  * Add a checkbox on items in show mode and a menu to apply an action to several items (fix #427)
  * Add a default Order by and Sort option in profile (fix #370)
  * Add a user preference for generating PDF with CJK fonts (fix #350)
  * Add user pref for single column layout (fix #410)
  * Add possibility to use Markdown in the text editor (fix #302)

* Enhancements:

  * Add the timestamped pdf to the zip archive (see #446)
  * Add an edit button in show mode
  * Check if deleted image is in body. Show warning (fix #432)
  * Submit the select-order-sort on change (fix #451)
  * Better performances in page loading speed
  * Add possibility to change the item type from edit mode
  * Gmagick is now optional. The code will fallback to gd if you don't have gmagick installed
  * Update ChemDoodle to 8.0.0
  * Remove forced capitalization of names (fix #461)

* Internationalization:

  * 100% translated in French
  * New strings need to be translated! See the contributing page to help

* Dev corner:

  * Use Symfony HttpFoundation components (Request/Response/Session/Cookies)
  * Use Guzzle for the requests instead of php-curl
  * Proper documentation of class fields
  * Better use of Twig templates
  * ...and a lot of code moved around, cleaned up, optimized, refactored, obliterated, fixed, ...

### [How to update](https://doc.elabftw.net/how-to-update.html)
### [How to install](https://doc.elabftw.net/)

result.name: elabftw-1.6.1
result.description:
This is a patch for 1.6.0.

## WARNING !! BREAKING CHANGE: if you are NOT using Docker, you need to install the PHP extension Gmagick. It can be installed with `pecl install gmagick-2.0.4RC1`.

### [How to update](https://elabftw.readthedocs.io/en/latest/how-to-update.html)

### [How to install](https://elabftw.readthedocs.io/en/latest/install.html)

Here is the changelog for this release:

* Bugfixes:

  * Workaround an issue when uploading SVG images containing text (#415) Thanks to @Athemis
  * Fix wrong redirect to admin panel from sysadmin panel (#404)

* Updates:

  * Update Colorpicker, Fancybox and Tinymce

* Dockerfile:

  * Workaround a bug in Firefox (https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1204670): generate random CN for self-signed certificate
  * Add freetype font (for SVG with text)
  * Modify CSP headers to allow blob: fix #406

result.name: elabftw-1.6.0
result.description:
I'm happy to announce the release of eLabFTW 1.6.0. This release brings new features and a few bugfixes. Please report any issue you might find with this release. If after the update it looks weird, refresh your browser's cache (Ctrl+F5) because a lot of CSS has changed ;)

## WARNING !! BREAKING CHANGE: if you are NOT using Docker, you need to install the PHP extension Gmagick. It can be installed with `pecl install gmagick-2.0.4RC1`.

### [How to update](https://elabftw.readthedocs.io/en/latest/how-to-update.html)

### [How to install](https://elabftw.readthedocs.io/en/latest/install.html)

Here is the changelog for this release:

* New features:

  * Add possibility to login through SAML with an Identity Provider (IDP) (fix #47)
  * Add thumbnails for tiff, pdf and svg files (fix #292 #346)

* Bugfixes:

  * Fix a bug where the permissions could not be correctly checked with the API
  * Fix search with multiple tags (thx @oli-ver) (fix #385)
  * Fix a bug where a bogus error message was shown to the user when updating profile (thx @mjeltsch)

* Enhancements:

  * New CSS design allowing more space for content, with a columns layout
  * CSS is now more responsive than ever
  * Status can allow timestamping or not (contribution by @Athemis) (fix #390)
  * Json in zip archive now contains more info (fix #381)
  * Admin can now write to experiments (fix #381)
  * Add image tools to edit an image in the body (fix #228)
  * Better JSON informations in zip export (fix #381)
  * Use a temporary path for pdf generation of zip archives (fix #382)
  * Externalisation and minimization of Javascript code
  * Add more supported extensions for 3Dmol.js (fix #398)
  * Add more highlighted languages (fix #398)
  * More pages use templates now
  * Code is getting cleaner and more elegant with each release :)

* Docker image:

  * Add gmagick extension
  * Use PHP's opcache to cache opcode and improve speed

* Dev corner:

  * Use docker for acceptance testing
  * Use yarn instead of bower for JS dependencies

result.name: elabftw-1.5.7
result.description:
And here is another patch for the 1.5 version :)

**WARNING**, if you don't use Docker: the `php-ctype` extension is now required!

# 1.5.7 Patch

* Bugfixes:

  * Fix a bug on the link generation of linked items in edit mode of experiments
  * Bring back the show related icon on db items view mode

# 1.5.6 Patch, maintenance and 1 new feature

* Bugfixes:

  * Fix a bug where the team groups were not showing in the user control panel for default visibility
  * Fix a bug where the star rating were not working
  * Fix the Save button from edit mode

* Enhancements:

  * Update fancybox to latest version (image viewer for attached pictures)
  * Update the JS dependencies to latest version
  * Update the PHP dependencies to latest version

* New feature:

  * Add possibility to add highlighted code (fix #375)

# 1.5.5 Patch:

  * Fix a bug where the number of unvalidated users was not shown in the footer
  * Fix a bug in the admin panel where parts of it were not accessible
  * Fix a bug where the Title would display escaped special characters

# 1.5.4 Patch:

  * Fix a bug limiting uploaded files to 2Mo
  * Fix a bug on Safari where text was not visible in the search bar (contribution from @oli-ver)
  * Fix a bug on Admin panel where you could not resize the template input textarea without messing everything up
  * Fix a bug where the server port was not correctly detected (fix #362)
  * Fix the display of uploaded images as album with Fancybox
  * Fix API key generation when not admin

# 1.5.3 Patch:

- Fix proper redirection to install page after a fresh install
- Fix editing templates (fix #365)

# 1.5.2 Patch:
- Fix issue where experiments where not showing on search page in some conditions (fix #353)
- Fix lists button for TinyMCE editor (fix #351)

# 1.5.1 Patch:
- Fix todolist shortcut not working

# 1.5.0 Release notes:

**WARNING**: if you maintain your own `Dockerfile`, or don't use Docker, you'll need to install php7-ctype (or php-ctype).

This release brings new features requested by the community and also improves drastically performance of the application. There are also two bugfixes included.

### [How to update](https://elabftw.readthedocs.io/en/latest/how-to-update.html)

### [How to install](https://elabftw.readthedocs.io/en/latest/install.html)

# Changelog

## New features:
- Page building time improved greatly thanks to the use of a templating engine
- Add an API so external programs can interact with eLabFTW (fix #328)
- Add possibility to order experiments by Comment (fix #320)
- Add possibility to read the asn1 encoded timestamping token (fix #315)
- Add possibility to draw something (doodle) (fix #198)
- Add possibility to filter experiments through visibility (or groups) (fix #335)
- Add title of experiment/item in the page title (fix #324)
- Add possibility to select the source of the mention plugin (fix #334)
- Add possibility to select default visibility for new experiments (fix #312)
- Add a "Read changelog" button when a new release is available (in Sysadmin panel)
- Add search with multiple tags (fix #332)

## Bugfixes:
- Fix an issue where two uploaded files with same name resulted in only one file in a zip archive
- Fix an issue where you couldn't create a zip/pdf of a list containing an experiment which is not yours

## Enhancements:
- Use less and better formed SQL queries, making the app 2 times faster
- Suggest SMTP2GO instead of mailgun for SMTP configuration
- Send an email to all admins if there are several upon new user registration
- Uploaded files are now stored in a subfolder of uploads/ (max subfolders: 256)
- Update composer dependencies to latest version

## Docker:
- Add a custom 404 page introducing Wally the wallaby
- Unset env var once config.php is written
- Add API redirect in nginx.conf
- Merge common parts of nginx.conf
- Drop SYS_PTRACE capability
- Set alpine version to 3.5
- Use libressl instead of openssl
- Remove sha384sum on composer install
- Use labels
- Add php-ctype to list of installed packages

## Developer corner:
- Use Twig as template engine
- Add canRead and canWrite properties to Entity objects
- Rename bgcolor to color and drop unused columns
- Move locale folder inside app/
- Remove functions.inc.php
- Remove js/, add compiled files in app/js, rest is in bower_components
- A lot of class instanciation/usage have been redefined to be more efficient and easy to use
- Improve code coverage

  * Fix a bug on Safari where text was not visible in the search bar (contribution from @oli-ver)
  * Fix a bug on Admin panel where you could not resize the template input textarea without messing everything up
  * Fix a bug where the server port was not correctly detected (fix #362)
  * Fix the display of uploaded images as album with Fancybox
  * Fix API key generation when not admin

# 1.5.3 Patch:

- Fix proper redirection to install page after a fresh install
- Fix editing templates (fix #365)

# 1.5.2 Patch:
- Fix issue where experiments where not showing on search page in some conditions (fix #353)
- Fix lists button for TinyMCE editor (fix #351)

# 1.5.1 Patch:
- Fix todolist shortcut not working

# 1.5.0 Release notes:

**WARNING**: if you maintain your own `Dockerfile`, or don't use Docker, you'll need to install php7-ctype (or php-ctype).

This release brings new features requested by the community and also improves drastically performance of the application. There are also two bugfixes included.

### [How to update](https://elabftw.readthedocs.io/en/latest/how-to-update.html)

### [How to install](https://elabftw.readthedocs.io/en/latest/install.html)

# Changelog

## New features:
- Page building time improved greatly thanks to the use of a templating engine
- Add an API so external programs can interact with eLabFTW (fix #328)
- Add possibility to order experiments by Comment (fix #320)
- Add possibility to read the asn1 encoded timestamping token (fix #315)
- Add possibility to draw something (doodle) (fix #198)
- Add possibility to filter experiments through visibility (or groups) (fix #335)
- Add title of experiment/item in the page title (fix #324)
- Add possibility to select the source of the mention plugin (fix #334)
- Add possibility to select default visibility for new experiments (fix #312)
- Add a "Read changelog" button when a new release is available (in Sysadmin panel)
- Add search with multiple tags (fix #332)

## Bugfixes:
- Fix an issue where two uploaded files with same name resulted in only one file in a zip archive
- Fix an issue where you couldn't create a zip/pdf of a list containing an experiment which is not yours

## Enhancements:
- Use less and better formed SQL queries, making the app 2 times faster
- Suggest SMTP2GO instead of mailgun for SMTP configuration
- Send an email to all admins if there are several upon new user registration
- Uploaded files are now stored in a subfolder of uploads/ (max subfolders: 256)
- Update composer dependencies to latest version

## Docker:
- Add a custom 404 page introducing Wally the wallaby
- Unset env var once config.php is written
- Add API redirect in nginx.conf
- Merge common parts of nginx.conf
- Drop SYS_PTRACE capability
- Set alpine version to 3.5
- Use libressl instead of openssl
- Remove sha384sum on composer install
- Use labels
- Add php-ctype to list of installed packages

## Developer corner:
- Use Twig as template engine
- Add canRead and canWrite properties to Entity objects
- Rename bgcolor to color and drop unused columns
- Move locale folder inside app/
- Remove functions.inc.php
- Remove js/, add compiled files in app/js, rest is in bower_components
- A lot of class instanciation/usage have been redefined to be more efficient and easy to use
- Improve code coverage

Patch to fix install on MySQL version 5.5.

result.name: elabftw-1.4.2
result.description:
This release is just a little patch to allow MySQL 5.5 users to upgrade.

**[How to update](https://elabftw.readthedocs.io/en/latest/how-to-update.html)**
**[How to install](https://elabftw.readthedocs.io/en/latest/install.html)**

## Version 1.4.1 changelog:

This release is mostly a **security patch** for CVE-2016-10033 and CVE-2016-10045. These vulnerabilities are related to the email library SwiftMailer.

**All users are encouraged to update as soon as possible!**

In this release, you'll also find:
- Enhancements:
  - The TODOlist is now stored in the MySQL database. Items can be reordered and edited (fix #124)
  - Improve handling of uploaded structure files that are not macromolecules (contribution by @Athemis)
  - Change div overflow from hidden to scroll (fix #314)
- Bugfixes:
  - Update Swiftmailer, fixing a vulnerability related to the php mail() function (https://thehackernews.com/2017/01/phpmailer-swiftmailer-zendmail.html)
  - Update the link for documentation to an external link, now that the documentation is no longer local

result.name: elabctl-1.4.0
result.description:
Here is the latest version of eLabFTW :)

**WARNING** the way to update changed (if you are using git). Read more about it in [the changelog](https://elabftw.readthedocs.io/en/latest/changelog.html). If you are using Docker, just do as usual.

This is because the `vendor` directory is not tracked by git anymore. So you need to install composer and install the php dependencies with composer yourself after an update (only git users, not Docker). Also, the documentation moved to another repository, the API doc is no more visible in the repo, and there is no more the gh-page branch (elabftw.net is no longer a github page, allowing me to have https). All of these changes make the repo much much lighter. And the commit log will not be polluted by documentation changes, etc. These changes don't really impact your average user, but for developers it's much better like this :)

I like the "release early, release often" mantra, so I don't want to keep these changes forever in a branch. So here it is.

In this release:
- New features:
  - **Autosave feature** when editing an experiment or an item
  - Admin can now see experiments with visibility set to 'only me' (fix #307)
- Enhancements:
  - Improve responsive design for mobile
  - Show installed version even if we can't access latest
  - Show date of latest release in sysadmin panel
  - Allow the use of unencrypted SMTP server
- Bugfixes:
  - Redirect to the install folder directly after install if SQL is not imported
  - Allow scrolling of text if it is very wide instead of just hiding it (fix #314)
- Internationalization:
  - Translated to Slovenian at 100% (thanks to Petra Kaferle)
  - Translated to Portuguese (Brazilian) at 100% (thanks to Carlos Kikuti)
- Docker image
  - Repository is now named elabftw/elabimg
  - Some capabilities are dropped
  - Composer is now installed in order to populate the vendor/ dir
- Dev corner:
  - The git repository got ligther. Documentation is now in `elabftw/elabdoc`. API doc is untracked. www.elabftw.net website is no more on the gh-pages branch but on `elabftw/elabweb`. With the removal of the `vendor` dir, this brings the total size of the repo down by about 50%.
  - img/ dir moved to app/

### [How to update](https://elabftw.readthedocs.io/en/latest/how-to-update.html)

### [How to install](https://elabftw.readthedocs.io/en/latest/)

result.name: elabftw-1.3.1
result.description:
This patch fixes two bugs:
- fix bug where admin of a team didn't receive an email when a new user registered
- fix bug where scheduler was not working on some browser/operating system combinations

Release notes for 1.3.0:
This release brings new features and some bug fixes. Major changes are:
- There is now a scheduler for items you want to be bookable. Go to the admin panel to set some items types bookables (microsocopes, rooms, machines, etc…). And go to the Team page to book them! (#238). Note: for some reason, this doesn't work on Firefox windows/mac, but works fine on Firefox GNU/Linux or Chrome (any OS).
- You can now see experiments from your team directly in your Experiments tab. Go to your user control panel to activate this option.
- Sysadmin can send a mass email and also edit users (#297)
- On the molecule editor, clicking save will now save the .mol file directly. (#174)
- The user interface has greatly improved thanks to the contributions of @ManonStripes.
- The password reset link is now valid for one hour only (#297)
- You can now use \ in title and body (#300)
- Translations have been updated
- Documentation changed quite a bit. Docker is now the default way to install eLabFTW
- All the dependencies are up to date

---
- See complete list of changes in the [Changelog](https://elabftw.readthedocs.io/en/hypernext/changelog.html#version-1-3-0)
- [How to install](https://elabftw.readthedocs.io/)
- [How to update](https://elabftw.readthedocs.io/en/hypernext/how-to-update.html)
- [Subscribe to the newsletter to receive an email when a new version is released](http://eepurl.com/bTjcMj)

---

Thanks to the contributors, your help is very appreciated :)

Note: it's a good idea to convert your normal install to a Docker install ([see doc](https://elabftw.readthedocs.io/en/hypernext/upgrade-to-docker.html)). It will facilitate updates and backups with the `elabctl` tool ;)

Cheers,
~Nico

ENJOY!

result.name: elabftw-1.2.2
result.description:
Hello,

This is a quick patch for 1.2.1. If you are upgrading from 1.2.1, a simple git pull is enough. The main issue was a typo preventing users to reset their password. See [the changelog](https://elabftw.readthedocs.io/en/latest/changelog.html) for full list of changes.

**PLEASE READ THE NOTES BELOW**

**If you are upgrading from 1.2.0-p3** : 
There is a major update to the Crypto library used to store the encrypted passwords (for SMTP and timestamp). It will need to write a new key to the config file. **If you are using Docker, make sure to read [the changelog](https://elabftw.readthedocs.io/en/hypernext/changelog.html#version-1-2-1)!**

**WARNING : for Docker users you need a manual step!!!** Check [the changelog](https://elabftw.readthedocs.io/en/hypernext/changelog.html#version-1-2-1).

For non docker users, make sure that `config.php` is writeable by the webserver (see changelog). Try `chmod 777 config.php`. If it's not, it will tell you anyway.

**For Mac OS users**
If you get an 'Integrity check fail' error. First make sure your config file is writeable (`chmod 777 config.php`). And run these SQL commands from phpmyadmin (select the elabftw database and click SQL to run SQL commands).
**WARNING** this will delete the smtp password that you have saved in the sysconfig panel! (and any timestamping password you might have put). Make sure that you know this password!

``` sql
update config set conf_value = '' where conf_name = 'smtp_password';
update config set conf_value = '' where conf_name = 'stamppass';
update teams set stamppass = null where team_id = 1;
```

Refresh the page and everything should be good. Put back your smtp password now. See issue #268.

**If you are upgrading from before 1.2.0-p3** please upgrade first to 1.2.0-p3. First, read the [release notes](https://github.com/elabftw/elabftw/releases/tag/1.2.0-p2), and then upgrade if you have php > 5.6. You can do that like this:

``` sh
#instead of doing git pull, we pull a specific version
git pull origin 1.2.0-p3
```

See the [changelog](https://elabftw.readthedocs.io/en/latest/changelog.html) for a complete list of changes.

---

As you can see, there are a lot of releases for elabftw. Well, that's because it's actively developed and maintained. Also, I don't like to have bugs in the latest release, so I release another one with a patch immediatly after a (critical) bug is found. In the next releases I will focus more on bringing new features (like a booking system) than improving the codebase. But it always has to be a balance between improving codebase/updating libraries (so changing things that the user will not see) and introducing new features. Lately it has been more on the improving the codebase side because eLab needed a good rewrite of the internal code to be more efficient, smart and fast. This previous work will also facilitate future improvements to the software. Think of building a house, you need good foundations.

eLabFTW is rapidly gaining popularity amongst researchers and research institute around the globe. This is very good news, it means it answers a demand for a free, open-source electronic lab notebook allowing timestamping of experiments.

Thanks to everyone who contributed so far, by translating, writing code or finding issues :)

ENJOY!

~Nico

result.name: elabftw-1.2.1
result.description:
Hello,

This release is a major update to the Crypto library used to store the encrypted passwords (for SMTP and timestamp). It will need to write a new key to the config file. **If you are using Docker, make sure to read [the changelog](https://elabftw.readthedocs.io/en/hypernext/changelog.html#version-1-2-1)!**

**WARNING : for Docker users you need a manual step!!!** Check [the changelog](https://elabftw.readthedocs.io/en/hypernext/changelog.html#version-1-2-1).

For non docker users, make sure that `config.php` is writeable by the webserver (see changelog).

This release also fixes a bug leading to new users being always validated after registration.

See the changelog for a complete list of changes.

ENJOY!

Note: this release contains a bug preventing users from resetting their password. This bug will be fixed in the next release coming out in a few days :)

result.name: elabftw-1.2.0-p3
result.description:
Yet another patch I know, but it is necessary.
- fix first user detection (first user was not given sysadmin rights)
- fix import sql function behavior with pdo object

These patches only impact a fresh install.

result.name: elabftw-1.2.0-p2
result.description:
I'm pleased to announce the immediate availability of eLabFTW 1.2.0

This version is a major rewrite of the internal code to avoid duplication, bugs and to allow more future improvements.
Most of the procedural code was rewritten in an object oriented manner. This leads to better maintainability, robustness and cleanliness of the app. There was also numerous improvements on the cloud (drop) and docker installs.

Here are some of the changes:
- Big changes
  - The username is no more! Login with your email. That happened because:
    - Usernames were not used
    - People tend to forget the username they picked, but always remember their email
    - It simplifies the code by removing clutter
  - Timestamping with openssl has a bug! So we use Java.
    - See [this issue](https://github.com/elabftw/elabftw/issues/242)
    - TL;DR It is due to a bug in the OpenSSL library and a change on how the default TSA replies
    - If you install Java you can continue to timestamp
    - If you use Docker, updating the container is enough
  - ===> **You need php 5.6 at least** !!!!
- New features
  - Add possibility to promote a user to SysAdmin
  - Add possibility to delete an empty team
  - Add a way to test email configuration directly from config page
  - Add possibility to clear the logs
  - Show usage statistics on sysconfig page
  - Show informations about the server on sysconfig page
  - Allow searching for elabid
  - Add buttons to show more or show all items
- Enhancements
  - Improved layout for displaying users, status and items types
  - Improved translation for french, add terms
  - Better notification system
  - Improved "Create new" menus
  - Users using a docker container can now use Let's Encrypt certificates easily
  - Install on a drop is now using a Docker image, and automatic Let's Encrypt certificates
- Documentation
  - Better doc for install on Drop
- Developer corner
  - A lot of things changed under the hood, with the creation of app/models, views and controllers
  - Code moved around to try to have something that looks like an MVC seen from very far away
  - Optimize page load by doing less useless SQL requests
  - Add asynchronous calls everywhere
  - Updated composer components
  - Removed some duplicated code
  - Removed useless code
  - Better CSS code
  - Replace die and exit by Exceptions

[How to update](https://elabftw.readthedocs.io/en/hypernext/how-to-update.html)
[How to install](https://elabftw.readthedocs.io/en/hypernext/index.html)

If you see weird things, empty your browser's cache (or do ctrl+shift+r).

As always, contributions to the code, opening issues to discuss features or bugs are welcome :)

Regards,
~Nico

# 1.2.0-p1
- fix issue on php 5.6 preventing display of sysconfig.php (#251)
- fix issue with imported csv without title (#249)

# 1.2.0-p2
- fix install
- fix team groups
- remove wrong column in banned_users table
- remove username mention on statistics page

result.name: elabftw-1.1.7
result.description:
Here is the latest stable release of elabftw. Featuring some bugfixes but also new features and enhancements.

[How to update](https://elabftw.readthedocs.org/en/stable/how-to-update.html)

Changelog :
- Bug fixes
  - fix bug where list text size was incorrect (fixed upstream by tinymce devs; #158)
  - fix bug where color of items/status was wrong after editing it
  - fix bug in Docker implementation missing SECRET_KEY value in config file
  - fix bug in SQL syntax of the show action for tags
- Enhancements
  - You can now link experiments directly in text with the `#` autocomplete (fix #191)
  - Search page: when searching for experiments of the whole team, you'll get a list of tags from the whole team
  - Tags autocomplete: now showing completion from the team's tags
  - Molecular structure files (PDB/MOL2/SDF/mmCIF) are previewed using 3Dmol.js (fix #213) Thanks @Athemis.
  - Default hashing algorithm for files changed from md5 to sha256 (thanks @Athemis)
  - Add a pretty loader for autocomplete
- Developer corner
  - use grunt to minify all the JS and CSS files in one
  - updated composer and bower components
  - created the Upload class

result.name: elabftw-1.1.6
result.description:
Hello,

This release is mostly a maintenance release. Not a lot of new features inside. Some bugfixes. Here is the changelog : 
- Bug fixes
  - fix bug on capitalized images extensions (fix #195)
  - fix bug where quotes could break the mention plugin
  - fix bad login url sent to validated users (thx Joke)
- Enhancements
  - Better view on low resolution display (fix #204)
  - Disallow empty title in quicksave
  - add autocomplete to DB items (fix #190)
  - Change new version available banner color
  - Add absract display on mouse hover (fix #196)
  - Add download .asn1 button on timestamped experiments
  - Add autocomplete=off on admin page form
  - Add possibility to have floating images (fix #186)
- Documentation
  - Better manual
- Developer corner
  - use colorpicker instead of colorwheel, remove raphael.js dependance

Please update your installation to this version by following the [documentation](https://elabftw.readthedocs.org/en/stable/how-to-update.html).

result.name: elabftw-1.1.5-p2
result.description: Fix #183 :  a bug in permission check of DB items export (pdf/zip). Thanks @felipetraj for reporting it :)

result.name: elabftw-1.1.5-p1
result.description:
Hello,

I am happy to release the 1.1.5 version of eLabFTW. As you can see below, there is a good number of improvements and new features.

Hope you enjoy. As always, report bugs you might find on GitHub :)

[How to update](https://elabftw.readthedocs.org/en/next/how-to-update.html)
[How to install](https://elabftw.readthedocs.org)

After running the update script, you will see an error message that you can safely ignore.

Changelog for version 1.1.5 : 
- Bug fixes
  - fix bug on pdf generation: md5 sum of files not showing
  - fix 'Error getting latest version from server'
  - fix cookies not working properly
  - fix bug related to deletion of files upon user deletion
- New features
  - add user groups (check it out in the admin panel: visibility of experiments can now be set on a group of team members
  - add Remember me button on login page
  - add autocompletion to experiments (write # to get item list) (fix #65)
- Enhancements
  - new registered users will get the server lang as lang
  - tag list on search page is now filtered by selected user
  - improve zip import now also imports attached files to an item (fix #21)
  - add .elabftw.json file in zip archives (to allow easy reimport)
  - remove MANIFEST file from zip archives
  - remove .export.txt file from zip archives
- Documentation
  - move doc to reStructeredText (in doc/_build/html)
  - documentation is hosted at https://elabftw.rtfd.org
  - remove clutter on README.md (and add BADGES!!)
- Developer corner
  - add unit and acceptance tests
  - update composer components
  - use [Defuse/php-encryption](https://github.com/defuse/php-encryption/) for encryption library
  - add API documentation (in doc/api)
  - class Db is a singleton
  - numerous code improvements (see git log)

Changelog for 1.1.5-p1 : 
- Bugfix
  - fix bug affecting users using SMTP to send emails (thanks @pmutka)
- Enhancements
  - some small CSS fixes
  - other small changes

result.name: elabftw-1.1.4-p3
result.description:
# Version 1.1.4
- add ordering options to items types, status and templates
  This means that you can now drag and drop them from the Admin panel, and the order will be kept. So you can reorganize them. 
- add possibility to export experiments templates to a file (.elabftw.tpl)
  So you can share your experiments templates
- add possibility to import a template from a .elabftw.tpl file
  If you can export, you will want to import them also!
- add possibility to import .elabftw.zip archives in the database
  The attached files will not be uploaded along. This is for the next update.
- **Timestamping** : 
  The timestamp is now properly validated, the token will be saved in the zip export, along with the timestamped pdf so you can validate them again externally if you wish. Now by default the timestamping is free (use of pki.dfn.de). More info [on the wiki](https://github.com/elabftw/elabftw/wiki/finalizing#setting-up-timestamping)
- **For chemists**
  If you like to draw molecule, go have a look in your preferences ![ucp](https://github.com/elabftw/elabftw/raw/master/img/settings.png), and tick the case to display the editor. Also, .mol files will get a nice thumbnail render in view mode :)
- add pagebreak tag in editor
  So you can split your text when you want, and have beautiful pdfs.
- max file upload size is now based on system configuration (thx @jcapellman)
  The max upload size was 2 Mo, now it looks for the max value in the php configuration file.
- fix bug in search page showing tags of other teams
- fix bug in search page returning items from other teams
- update tinymce to 4.1.10
- update jquery to 2.1.4
- update SwiftMailer to 5.4.1
- various improvements in the code

If you update from a version older than 1.1.2 : update first to 1.1.2 ([see this issue](https://github.com/elabftw/elabftw/issues/172#issuecomment-120538920)).

You can find a [manual here](https://github.com/elabftw/elabftw/raw/master/doc/man-elabftw.pdf).

You can find [instructions on updating here](https://github.com/elabftw/elabftw/wiki/How%20to%20update)

### Version 1.1.4-p2

This release is like 1.1.4 but with a patch fixing a bug in ZIP/CSV generation and another one for displaying the correct installed version on sysconfig page.

### Version 1.1.4-p3

This patch fixes a critical bug in the install script that could lead to loosing data.
Thanks to Tomáš for finding this bug!

ENJOY!

~Nicolas

result.name: elabftw-1.1.3
result.description:
Here is a new release for elab : 
- fix : bug related to file deletion
- fix : bug related to experiment duplication (duplicated experiment was not showing in exp list)
- add : you get redirected to the page you wanted to see after login
- add : new ways to send emails (thanks to @Athemis)
- add : organization level for visibility setting. This means that if you put your experiment visibility on 'Everyone with an account', you can share the link between teams.
- add : user guide in the /doc folder
- add : version is displayed on sysadmin page
- misc : code cleaning/improvements

To update : 
- use `git pull` if you installed it with git
- download the zip archive and unpack it at the right place to overwrite old files

result.name: elabftw-1.1.2-p1
result.description:
This is a patch release to version 1.1.2. Only minor modifications here, nothing fancy. Fix some translations, fix some css, update some components to latest version.

ENJOY ! :yellow_heart:

result.name: elabftw-1.1.2
result.description:
Hello,

I'm pleased to announce the availability of eLabFTW version 1.1.2 !

In this release : 
- add RFC 3161 compliant trusted timestamping (thanks to @Athemis ) (#100)
  This will allow you to use the Time Stamping Authority of your choice (as long as they have a RFC 3161 compliant way to interact, as many do).
- add filtering options (thanks to @timfalcucci) (#15)
- add encryption for passwords of SMTP and Timestamp stored in the SQL database (#129)
- add a check for curl extension at install (#141)
- add hidden field to prevent bot registration (#84)
- fix team_id not added on db tag add
- fix no experiments/db item showing if there is no tags
- fix prevent session propagation for installs on same server
- update mpdf library
- update swiftmailer library
- now requiring php 5.4 minimum

Thanks to everyone who participated through issues, pull requests or emails, your help is very valuable.

As always, some bugs are hidden in this release (I hope not too many), help me find them ! :D 

To update your current installation, either perform a `git pull` or download the zip and overwrite old files. **_Don't forget to visit the /update.php page to update the SQL !**_

Regards,
~Nico

result.name: elabftw-1.1.1
result.description:
This little release brings tag search on search page and also fixes a bug in the SQL install file.

To update : `git pull` or download archive and overwrite files, and then visite /update.php with a sysadmin account.

~Nico

result.name: elabftw-1.1.0
result.description:
This release brings some bugfixes but also some new features : 
- multiple file upload now possible
- add [ChemDoodle](http://web.chemdoodle.com/demos/sketcher) to draw chemical molecules for our chemists friends :)
- add a bash script in install folder to help beginners secure their installation
- fix a bug where the top right search bar was not searching at the good place if the lang was not english
- add a log view for the sysadmin
- fix a bug where a file was not properly deleted from system
- various little improvements in code

eLabFTW is gaining popularity fast and contributors are helping with pull requests and new issues.

A big thanks to all those who contributed to this release ;)

In the next release, there will be an implementation of RFC 3161 thanks to @Athemis and surely other nice things :)

**_To update :**_
- Either `git pull` or download the latest archive and extract it in the root folder.
- Then visit /update.php logged as a sysadmin.

**_Stay tuned!**_

~Nico

result.name: elabftw-1.0.0
result.description:
After more than 2 years of development I am very pleased to announce the availability of eLabFTW version 1.0.0 :D 

Since the beginning, this project evolved from a personal project, to something used in several labs all over the world by hundreds of people. I wish to thank all the people that helped me along the road with their ideas, their constructive criticism, their coding capabilities or their translating ones ;)

This release is no different from the previous beta version.

There are some nice features cooking for the next release :) 

**Stay tuned for more!**

~Nico

result.name: elabftw-1.0.0-beta
result.description:
The version 1.0.0 is approaching fast ! :D 

Here most of the changes are moving files around to avoid having too much files in the root folder.

result.name: elabftw-0.12.6
result.description:
Not a lot of things in this release, but the most important thing is the change in the way you update the database.
Before you needed to run update.php from the command line interface. Now it can be run from the web.

In fact I wanted to implement an easy way to get a new release, but it's not as easy as wordpress makes it look like. So we ended up in a weird situation, with the code to get and extract the latest zip archive is written, but not directly accessible because it's missing the last part : copying the extracted files over the old ones. (pull requests welcome ;) )

Of course this decision was driven by the fact that in the institute I work in, elabftw is run in a docker container, where you can't just ssh in it to update the database (well, you can but that's not the point). I think being able to run elabftw in a container is a good thing, so I try to change the code so it 'fits'.

Also in this release, there is a fix for using haproxy to handle ssl traffic to an http server. Not a lot of people will benefit from it, but it's here now. I want elabftw to be entreprise capable, and this kind of thing is often found in a complex network architecture, which is in turn often found in a modern research institute.

Finally, I added a little counter in the footer of the admin, so he can see if there is some users to validate.

As you might have noticed, the release schedule of elabftw is quite chaotic. And the length of the text accompanying the release is random (last release had two words...).
But that's the way I work. I publish a release, and not long after I start spotting bugs, so I need to make another release now that the recommended way to install is not git clone anymore but downloading the latest stable release, and the cycle goes on...

BTW, there is nothing stable in elabftw (yet), it needs to be considered as 'beta' software until it reaches version 1.0. It's stable in the way that it will not spontaneously explode, and globally works fine,  but the code is getting improved all the time!

If you are still reading, cheers :smiley: 

To conclude : thanks to everyone participating in this elabftw adventure. We're building the best ELN software together :D

MySQL version 5.6 is needed. 5.5 wont't work.

~Nico

result.name: elabftw-0.11.0-RC Release Candidate
result.description: New design by Manon Potier.

result.name: elabftw-0.10.1 - SmoothFix
result.description:
This update fixes a little bug in the authentication code.
It also adds logs to the database for logging errors, failed logins attempts and such.
It removes the l33t theme. This was something I added at the beginning because I wanted users to be able to customize interface. But one theme is enough already. Maybe in the future I'll add an option to change the background. Because that's what is important, not every little icons. Also this cleanups the code :)
Speaking of code cleanup, there was some in this update, too.

As always, to update :

``` sh
cd /path/to/elabftw
git pull
php update.php
```

ENJOY !

~Nico

result.name: elabftw-0.10.0 - Smoothweek
result.description:
This is stable version 0.10.0, codename Smoothweek. Yes, because now I give them codenames :D 

In  this release, several big improvements : 
- Possibility to host several teams on one install
- Better permissions system
- Upgraded javascript libraries
- Some bugs were crushed
- Full list of change in the [CHANGELOG](https://github.com/NicolasCARPi/elabftw/blob/master/CHANGELOG) file.

I drank a lot of smoothies during this week.

Please report any bug you might find with a github issue.

ENJOY !
~Nico

result.name: Version 0.9.5
result.description:
Version 0.9.5
- Use of bower to keep track of dependencies
- HTML5 video and audio can now be added
- Add a user preference to ask before leaving an edit page
- Add CSV file to ZIP exports
- Add a revision system (to be able to see old versions of an experiment)
- Add body to CSV export

and other small changes :)

result.name: Version 0.9.4.2
result.description:
Some bugs were crushed and some new things were added : 
- Add general template for experiments
- Add linked items and comments on PDF
- Easier install on Mac and Windows
- Add linked items list to pdf and list of attached files
- Add links button in editor
- Add image button in editor
- Add URL in CSV export
- Show the lock on database item
- Removed the html from zip export
- Fix div blocks not passing the filter and losing formatting (thx David !)
- Fix a bug with lock/unlock of

result.name: Version 0.9.4
result.description:
This version brings a lot of new features : 
- The config is now in the database and editable from the admin panel
- Security measures have been added
- The locking mechanism changed. Now you can't unlock/edit an experiments which have been locked by a 'locker' (PI).
- There is a setting to disallow users to delete experiments
- You can add comments on experiments
- The date format changed to YYYYMMDD
- Install is simplified

result.name: Version 0.9.1.2
result.description: Correcting some bugs and make everything more beautiful and fancy and nice and loveable :D

result.name: Version 0.9.1.1
result.description: There was a problem with the previous version. It is now fixed.

result.name: Version 0.9.1
result.description: The important change here is the possibility to limit the visibility of an experiment to yourself only.

result.name: Version 0.9
result.description:
This is version 0.9 :
- Newer versions of JQuery and JQuery UI
- config.ini is now config.php
- Cosmetic changes
- Ctrl-Shift-D will add the date in the editor
- Possibility to search experiments owned by a unique user
- Conformation to coding standard PSR-2
This release is marked as stable.

- Better editor (TinyMCE version 4)
- Save button to save everything without submitting the form (no more autosave)
- Better install process
- Check for updates button added

# Contributing to eLabFTW

Please see the [documentation](https://doc.elabftw.net/next/contributing.html).

**eLabFTW** is a collaborative project. Your contributions are very welcome! Have a look at the [contributing page](https://doc.elabftw.net/contributing.html) to see how you can help with translation or code.

result.affiliation: Institute of Biochemical Plant Physiology, Düsseldorf, Germany

result.value:
**eLabFTW** can easily be installed on any GNU/Linux server. It requires at least 512 MB of RAM (1 GB recommended) and 300 MB of disk space. Installation is done through Docker, so [Docker](https://www.docker.com/) needs to be installed on the server. Since it runs in a Docker container, php, webservers or mysql do not have to be installed on your server.  Everything is provided by the containers so different versions and extensions do not matter. This makes upgrading versions much easier.

The documentation explains everything:

Free support is available through [GitHub issues](https://github.com/elabftw/elabftw/issues/new/choose). Please open an issue if you have a problem, want to make a suggestion, ask a question or discuss a feature.

You can also join the [chat room on Gitter](https://gitter.im/elabftw/elabftw).
PRO support and professional hosting are available from [Deltablot](https://www.deltablot.com/elabftw).
